page.title: 04Farming; Upton Snodsbury
page.content:
The area is mainly devoted to farming. The soil is predominantly heavy clay but fertile and is divided equally between arable crops and pasture. Cereals are the main crops with winter sown wheat occupying the largest area. Arable farming is completely mechanised. the tractors used are very powerful in order to pull the heavy duty cultivating machinery. The grain is harvested by large combines and the straw is baled for winter bedding and fodder for the livestock.With present day heavy crops there is a surplus of straw which is now often burned in the field, but there is a growing dislike of this practice because of air pollution and damage to wildlife habitat.
